properties.areaDesc: Coastal waters from High Island to Freeport TX out 20 NM; Coastal waters from Freeport to Matagorda Ship Channel TX out 20 NM; Matagorda Bay; Galveston Bay; Waters from Freeport to Matagorda Ship Channel TX from 20 to 60 NM; Waters from High Island to Freeport TX from 20 to 60 NM
properties.headline: Special Marine Warning issued January 11 at 12:05AM CST until January 11 at 1:30AM CST by NWS Houston/Galveston TX
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in League City has issued a

* Special Marine Warning for...
Coastal waters from Freeport to Matagorda Ship Channel TX out 20
NM...
Coastal waters from High Island to Freeport TX out 20 NM...
Galveston Bay...
Matagorda Bay...
Waters from Freeport to Matagorda Ship Channel TX from 20 to 60
NM...
Waters from High Island to Freeport TX from 20 to 60 NM...

* Until 130 AM CST.

* At 1205 AM CST, strong thunderstorms were located along a line
extending from 19 nm southwest of Upper San Jacinto Bay to near
Matagorda Island 607, moving northeast at 55 knots.

HAZARD...Wind gusts to 40 knots.

SOURCE...Radar.

IMPACT...Small craft could be damaged in briefly higher winds and
suddenly higher waves.

* Locations impacted include...
Galveston A8, Matagorda Ship Channel, Tabs Buoy B, Galveston Bay
Entrance, Galveston Bay, Brazos 439, Matagorda Island 557,
Galveston 344, Galveston 424, Offatts Bayou, Galveston 221,
Galveston Pier 21, Trinity Bay, Palacios Bay, Galveston 282,
Galveston Causeway, Tabs Buoy W, Mitchell Bay, High Island A179 and
Surfside Jetty.

This warning also includes the following channel lights...

Freeport Entrance Lighted Buoy 4...
Freeport Entrance Lighted Buoy 1...
Houston Ship Channel Light 45...
Baytown Marina Channel Light 17...
Matagorda Ship Channel Lighted Buoy 1...
Houston Ship Channel Light 55...
Matagorda Ship Channel Light 34...
Freeport Entrance Light 10...
Galveston Channel Lighted Buoy 1 and
Houston Ship Channel Light 37.
properties.instruction:
A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CST for southeastern
Texas...and the adjacent coastal waters.

Move to safe harbor immediately as gusty winds and high waves are
expected.

Report severe weather to the Coast Guard or the National Weather
Service.
